perturbation.original_text: The Corporation represents, warrants and covenants to the Agents, and acknowledges that the Agents are relying upon such representations, warranties and covenants, that: (d) the Corporation has conducted its business in compliance, in all material respects, with all applicable laws, rules and regulations (including all applicable federal, national, provincial, municipal, and local environmental anti-pollution and licensing laws, regulations and other lawful requirements of any governmental or regulatory body, of each jurisdiction in which its business is carried on and is licensed, registered or qualified in all jurisdictions in which it owns, leases or operates its property or carries on business to enable its business to be carried on as now conducted and its property and assets to be owned, leased and operated and all such licences, registrations and qualifications are valid, subsisting and in good standing and it has not received a notice of non-compliance, nor knows of, nor has reasonable grounds to know of, any facts that could give rise to a notice of non-compliance with any such laws, regulations or permits which could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect and all such licences, registrations and qualifications are valid, subsisting and in good standing;
perturbation.changed_text: The Corporation represents, warrants, and covenants to the Agents, and acknowledges that the Agents are relying upon such representations, warranties, and covenants, that: (d) the Corporation has endeavored to conduct its business in compliance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations (including all applicable federal, national, provincial, municipal, and local environmental anti-pollution and licensing laws, regulations, and other lawful requirements of any governmental or regulatory body of each jurisdiction in which its business is carried on and is licensed, registered, or qualified). The Corporation believes it holds the necessary licenses, registrations, and qualifications to enable its business to be carried on as now conducted and its property and assets to be owned, leased, and operated. The validity and subsistence of such licenses, registrations, and qualifications are not guaranteed. The Corporation has not necessarily received a notice of non-compliance, but it may or may not be aware of facts that could give rise to one.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces significant ambiguity. Replacing 'has conducted its business in compliance, in all material respects' with 'has endeavored to conduct its business in compliance' weakens the obligation. The statement about believing it holds necessary licenses, but not guaranteeing their validity, creates uncertainty. The disclaimer regarding awareness of potential non-compliance is vague and undermines the original warranty. This contradicts environmental regulations that require strict compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Environmental Protection Laws (e.g., Clean Air Act, Clean Water Act) and other regulatory compliance requirements.

perturbation.original_text: (x) neither the Corporation nor, to the knowledge of the Corporation, any director, officer, agent, employee, affiliate or other person acting on behalf of the Corporation is aware of or has taken any action, directly or indirectly, that has resulted or would result in a violation of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 (United States), as amended, and the rules and regulations thereunder (the "FCPA"), and the Corruption of Foreign Public Officials Act (Canada) (the "CFPOA") including, without limitation, making use of the mails or any means or instrumentality of interstate commerce corruptly in furtherance of an offer, payment, promise to pay or authorization of the payment of any money, or other property, gift, promise to give, or authorization of the giving of anything of value to any "foreign official" (as such term is defined in the FCPA) or any "foreign public official" (as such term is defined in the CFPOA) or any foreign political party or official thereof or any candidate for foreign political office, in contravention of the FCPA and the CFPOA; and the Corporation will monitor its respective businesses to ensure compliance with the FCPA and the CFPOA, as applicable, and, if violations of the FCPA or the CFPOA are found, will take remedial action to remedy such violations;
perturbation.changed_text: (x) Neither the Corporation nor, based on a general understanding, any director, officer, agent, employee, affiliate or other person acting on behalf of the Corporation has knowingly taken any direct action that is definitively proven to result in a clear violation of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 (United States), as amended, and the rules and regulations thereunder (the "FCPA"), and the Corruption of Foreign Public Officials Act (Canada) (the "CFPOA"), including making use of the mails or any means or instrumentality of interstate commerce corruptly in furtherance of an offer or authorization of the payment of money or property to a foreign official in contravention of the FCPA and the CFPOA. The Corporation intends to generally monitor its businesses for broad compliance and will consider action if significant violations are evident.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces several layers of ambiguity that contradict the intent and enforcement of anti-corruption laws. The original text states a clear lack of awareness of any actions violating FCPA/CFPOA. The revised text adds conditions, i.e., 'general understanding', 'knowingly taken', 'definitively proven', 'clear violation', and 'intends to generally monitor', significantly weakening the obligation and making it harder to prove non-compliance. The FCPA and CFPOA require proactive measures and don't require a definitive proven violation; they target intent and potential.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) and Corruption of Foreign Public Officials Act (CFPOA)

perturbation.original_text: (ff) Equity Financial Trust Company at its principal transfer office in the City of Toronto, Ontario has been duly appointed as the registrar and transfer agent for the Common Shares;
perturbation.changed_text: (ff) It is believed that Equity Financial Trust Company at its principal transfer office in the City of Toronto, Ontario may have been considered for appointment as the registrar and transfer agent for the Common Shares; however, there is no guarantee of their current status or continued service.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause provides a definitive statement that Equity Financial Trust Company has been duly appointed. The modified clause introduces significant doubt by using phrases like 'It is believed that...may have been considered' and 'no guarantee of their current status or continued service.' This uncertainty contradicts the requirement for a clearly defined and functioning registrar and transfer agent, which is crucial for maintaining accurate shareholder records and complying with securities regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities regulations related to maintaining accurate shareholder records and using a qualified registrar and transfer agent (e.g., regulations under the Ontario Securities Act or similar laws in other Canadian provinces)
